meanings.def: living or growing in natural conditions; not kept in a house or on a farm
examples: wild animals/birds/flowers
wild salmon
wild mushrooms/rice
The plants grow wild along the banks of rivers.
Their aim is to document wild populations of fast-disappearing species.
a wild boar
The dogs live wild on the streets.
The flowers grow wild in the mountains.
a wild rabbit
wild strawberries

meanings.def: in its natural state; not changed by people
examples: the destruction of forests and other wild lands
wild moorland
The island is a wild and lonely place.
This is truly wild and unspoilt countryside.
The boy is wild and completely out of control.
He had a wild look in his eyes.
a woman with wild hair
wild mood swings
There is a wild side to him.
Her hair was rather wild.
The band has a reputation for wild behaviour.
The crowd went wild.
It makes me wild (= very angry) to see such waste.
Everything about her drove him wild (= made him like her very much).
wild laughter/celebrations
The couple were dancing with wild abandon.
When the band appeared, the crowd went wild.
The crowd was wild with excitement.
It's the story of a wild and romantic love affair.
Nothing could dull the sense of wild excitement that gripped them.
His speech was greeted by wild applause.

meanings.def: not carefully planned; not sensible or accurate
examples: He made a wild guess at the answer.
wild accusations
We had a wild time in New York.
She's totally wild about him.
She was absolutely wild about him.
I'm not wild about the idea.

meanings.def: affected by storms and strong winds
examples: a wild night
The sea was wild.

meanings.def: far more, better, etc. than you could ever have imagined or hoped for
used to say that something has happened in a way that somebody did not expect at all
examples: Never in my wildest dreams did I think I'd meet him again.

meanings.def: to grow or develop freely without any control
examples: The ivy has run wild.
Let your imagination run wild and be creative.
I just let my imagination run wild and come up with as many ideas as I can.

meanings.def: if children or animals run wild, they behave as they like because nobody is controlling them
examples: Those boys have been allowed to run wild.
They annoy the neighbours because they let their children run wild.

meanings.def: to go through a period of wild behaviour while young, especially having a lot of romantic or sexual relationships
examples: He wants to leave home, sow his wild oats and learn about life.

meanings.def: used to say that nothing would persuade somebody to go somewhere or do something they do not want to do

idioms.def: far more, better, etc. than you could ever have imagined or hoped for
used to say that something has happened in a way that somebody did not expect at all
examples: Never in my wildest dreams did I think I'd meet him again.

idioms.def: to grow or develop freely without any control
examples: The ivy has run wild.
Let your imagination run wild and be creative.
I just let my imagination run wild and come up with as many ideas as I can.
Those boys have been allowed to run wild.
They annoy the neighbours because they let their children run wild.

idioms.def: to go through a period of wild behaviour while young, especially having a lot of romantic or sexual relationships
examples: He wants to leave home, sow his wild oats and learn about life.

idioms.idiom: wild horses would not drag somebody somewhere, make somebody do something, etc.
idioms.def: used to say that nothing would persuade somebody to go somewhere or do something they do not want to do

meanings.def: a natural environment that is not controlled by people
examples: The bird is too tame now to survive in the wild.
The animals were released back into the wild when they had recovered.
There are very few of these birds left in the wild.
When they have reared sufficient numbers in zoos, they will begin to return them to the wild.

meanings.def: areas of a country far from towns or cities, where few people live
examples: wandering through the wilds of Alaska
(humorous) They live on a farm somewhere out in the wilds.
The cottage was right out in the wilds, miles from anywhere.
These girls came from the wilds of the rural west.
They lived in the wilds of central Wales.
